author.name: Brother Arnulfus
author.description: A Benedictine monk who doth write devotional poems in Ænglish, praising God and the saints. His poems are often humorous, short, and satirical. They often contain metaphors of alcohol, especially wine or ale.

newsMedieval:
In London town, as dawn did rise,
Metal's worth hit the skies.
A dollar down, increases boon,
As ale doth froth 'neath the moon.

Yon dollar falls, stocks take flight,
In risk-averse, the rooster's night.
As chest of gold may heart ensnare,
So ties our fortune fine and fair.

Praise be to God, Honda's might,
More than doubled in the night.
In car's kingdom, chips rain plenty,
Profit flows, coffers aren't empty.

feedItems.title: Metals Inch Higher as Dollar Slides
feedItems.description: Metals prices were rising in early London trading as a sliding dollar helped boost commodities.

feedItems.title: Dollar Falls as Stocks Rebound
feedItems.description: The safe-haven dollar turned lower after stocks rebounded, but MUFG expects the currency to remain supported, given a mostly risk-averse environment.

feedItems.title: Honda More Than Doubled First-Quarter Net Profit as Car Business Recovered
feedItems.description: Honda Motor’s first-quarter net profit more than doubled from a year earlier, driven by a sharp recovery in earnings at its car business as the chip shortage eased.

author.name: Guillemette de Ventadour
author.description: A whimsical troubadour from Occitania, who cherishes the company of nature's gentle creatures. She often includes metaphors of goats, dogs, rabbits, and snails in her poetry. Her writing style is terse.

newsMedieval:
In summer's glow, TUI finds its zest,
Gold flows like goats on mountain crest.
Full books surround like rabbits' nest,
Ere pandemic, in fortune dressed.

Sony, the hound, does mourn its score,
Profits, like snails, slide less than yore.
In movie lore and finance bore,
Comes quieter the triumphant roar.

Vestas, the hare, its stride does miss,
In loss right deeper than abyss.
Yet guidance stands and hope persists,
Strong grows the service amidst the risks.

feedItems.title: TUI Swings to Profit
feedItems.description: TUI reported an underlying Ebit of €169.4 million in the third quarter, and said its summer bookings were at 95% of the level seen pre-pandemic.

feedItems.title: Sony Group's First-Quarter Net Hurt by Weaker Movie, Financial Earnings
feedItems.description: Sony Group’s first-quarter net profit fell 17% from a year earlier due to weaker earnings from movie and financial businesses.

feedItems.title: Vestas Earnings Miss Views but Maintains Guidance
feedItems.description: Vestas posted a larger-than-expected net loss of €115 million in the second quarter but backed its full-year guidance after seeing strong growth in its service business.

author.name: Æthelred the Skald
author.description: A Norse poet who doth regale his audience with tales of gods and heroes, praising their might and prowess. He references Norse mythology and history in his poems. He is known for metaphors involving the sea and the weather and weaponry.

newsMedieval:
From East comes a tale of the market's turn,
Kofi tales woven 'neath the sky's burning urn.
The thunder of trade hits an icy wall,
Æsir's fury in Nikkei's fall.

Epic deeds of ABN, told by scribes,
Unyielding, like the All-Father's tribe.
Yet like frigid winters, costs lay low,
Their ambition's fire, a dimmed glow.

E.ON then rides on the gale,
Great Freyr's boon in sales detail.
Wholesale's tempest at bay doth hold,
Their treasures swell, their saga bold.

feedItems.title: Nikkei Falls 0.53%, Dragged by Financial Stocks
feedItems.description: Japanese stocks ended lower, dragged by falls in financial stocks, as concerns resurface about the health of the U.S. banking sector and domestic bond yields decline.

feedItems.title: ABN Amro Profit, Income Beat Views
feedItems.description: ABN Amro Bank posted second quarter operating income and net profit ahead of expectations but lowered its cost guidance for the year to €5.2 billion and doesn’t expect to reach its 2024 target of €4.7 billion.

feedItems.title: E.ON Earnings Boosted by Drop in Wholesale Prices
feedItems.description: E.ON raised its forecast for the full year after it reported a rise in adjusted earnings to €3 billion for the second quarter due to more stable wholesale energy prices.

author.name: Conchobar mac Dubhthach
author.description: An Irish bard of yore, who weaves dulcet melodies that capture hearts with tender love songs. With a quill dipped in courtly love, he pens metaphors of devotion, igniting the flames of passion in every soul who hears his verse.

newsMedieval:
The eastern phoenix spreads its wing, profits fly,
Covid shroud hath lifted, bringing joy so nigh.
Cathay's tale of hardship into gold is spun,
With half the year, their rousing victory won.

In the realm of China, where the dragons lie,
Ban on certain gold, 'pon Biden's cry.
Yet though the skies are dark, a light peeks shy,
Disclose ye, venture lords, where treasures lie.

Then to Niger's land, the story swiftly goes,
Where America's favorite general 'pon courage sows.
'Gainst the iron-clad veil of extremism, he rows,
Salaou Barmou, with the junta he bestows.

feedItems.title: Cathay Pacific Swung to Profit in First Half
feedItems.description: Cathay Pacific Airways swung to profit in the first half of the year, benefiting from the lifting of Covid-19 curbs that pushed up passenger revenue substantially.

feedItems.title: U.S. to Ban Some Investments in China
feedItems.description: President Biden plans to sign an executive order that will also require U.S. private-equity and venture-capital firms to disclose certain investments in the country.

feedItems.title: One of America's Favorite Generals Leads the Niger Coup
feedItems.description: Brig. Gen. Moussa Salaou Barmou, long courted by Washington as a partner against Islamist extremism, has emerged as the main diplomatic channel between the U.S. and the junta.
